officialTitle: A Large, International, Placebo-controlled, Factorial Trial to Assess the Impact of Clonidine and Acetyl-salicylic Acid (ASA) in Patients Undergoing Noncardiac Surgery Who Are at Risk of a Perioperative Cardiovascular Event
summary: Major surgeries not involving the heart are common, and major heart problems during or after such surgeries represent a large population health problem. Few treatments to prevent heart problems around the time of surgery have been tested. There is encouraging data suggesting that small doses of Acetyl-Salicylic Acid (ASA) and Clonidine, which are two medications, given individually for a short period before and after major surgeries may prevent major heart problems. The POISE-2 Trial is a large international study to test if ASA and Clonidine can prevent heart attacks and deaths from heart problems around the time of surgery.

primaryOutcome.measure: Composite of All-cause Mortality and Nonfatal MI
